intro: Cliffortia juniperina var. juniperina, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to coastal and mountainous regions. It is often found in fynbos vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. The species is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
